div.l: For al his keping / and his Ielusie
And absolon̄ hath kissed hir͗e neþer ey
And Nicholas is scalded in the toute
This tale is done and god saue al þe route
Here endeth þe myllers tale // of hende Nicholas ⁊and absolon̄

And next
biginneth the prolog of þe Carpenters tale
Whan folk had loughen̄ at þis nice caas
Of Absolon̄ and hende Nicholas
Dyuers folk diuerseli þei seid
But for þe more ꝑpartie þei laughed and pleid
Ne at his tale ne sawe I no man him greue
But it wer͗e oonli oswald þe Reue
Bi cause he was of carpenters craft
A litul Ire in his hert was laft
He began to grocche and blamed him a lite
Sith ick qduod he ful well couthe I þe quite
With blering of a proude Millers eye
If þat me lust to speke of ribaudrie
But eke I am olde me list not pley for age
Gresse tyme is done my foder is for age
This white toppe wrieth myn olde yeres
Myn hert is also mowled as my heres
But þus I fare as doth an open ers
Þat ilk frute is euer langer þe wers
Til it be roten̄ in mullok or in stre
We olde I drede so far͗e we
Til we be roten̄ we can not be ripe
We hope alwey whiles þe world wil pipe
For in oure will þer stikkis euer a naile
To haue an hore hede and a grene taile
As hath a leke for þough oure might be gone
Oure wil desired euer in one
For whan we not do þen wol we speke
Yit in oure asshes is olde fir͗e Ireke
Four͗e glides haue we which I shal devise
A vanting lying angr͗e and couetise
Thies iiij· sparkez longen to elde
Oure olde lymes may wele be vnwelde
But wil shal not faile it is soth
And yit haue I alwey a coltez tothe
As many a yere as yit is passed henne
Sethen my tap of life bigan to grennegennerenne
div.note: Only one 1 rounded stroke, most resembling the scribe's "g," was made before "r" was overwritten.
div.l: For sekirliche whan I was born anone
